intro: Varronia mariana, commonly known as the Florida varronia, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant produces showy, yellow flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are ovate and often have a hairy texture, while its stems are woody and branched. Varronia mariana is typically found in wetlands and along the edges of swamps, where it thrives in moist, sandy soils.
